definition: to offend
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
to get angry

sentences.english: Your negative emotions aren’t there to annoy you or distract you.
sentences.chinese: 你的负面情绪不会惹恼你，或困扰你。

sentences.english: IT IS a fair bet that one of Barack Obama’s new-year’s resolutions was to rattle Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马新年改革之一很有可能会惹恼华尔街。

sentences.english: The show ruffled feathers among Beijing's commissars.
sentences.chinese: 这档节目惹恼了北京的高层。

sentences.english: He back and don't rap to me, I know that he is annoyed by my words.
sentences.chinese: 他背过身去不理我，我知道他肯定是被我的话惹恼了。

sentences.english: The ecumenical approach seemed to annoy some executives.
sentences.chinese: 这种普遍采取的做法似乎惹恼了一些决策者。

sentences.english: What about when people are trying to enrage you?
sentences.chinese: 那么当别人试图惹恼你时，你怎样？

sentences.english: A noisy noise annoys an oyster.
He aggravates her just by looking at her.
sentences.chinese: 他只是看着她就把她惹恼了。

sentences.english: Keep them informative yet concise . People want information quickly, and withholding it only annoys them.
sentences.chinese: 人们希望迅速获得信息，藏着掖着只会惹恼他们。

sentences.english: They get annoyed with language problems, and they don't seem willing to assist.
sentences.chinese: 语言问题惹恼他们，他们也似乎不愿意提供协助。

sentences.english: He has upset a country who rightly are not remotely concerned about Great Britains views.
sentences.chinese: 再说，他惹恼了一个无视英国意见的国家。

sentences.english: Gerald was nettled by this implication of vulgar materialism.
sentences.chinese: 杰拉德被她话语中流露出的庸俗唯物主义惹恼了。

sentences.english: If someone irritates you, it is only your own response that is irritating you.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人惹恼你，那只是你自己的反应惹恼了你。

sentences.english: If someone irritates you, it is only your own response that is irritating you.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人惹恼你，那只是你自己的反应惹恼了你。

sentences.english: If there is something getting Auster's goat, it's American politics.
sentences.chinese: 如果说有什么惹恼了奥斯特，那便是美国的政治。

definition: to provoke anger
to anger sb/to enrage
to infuriate/to enrage/to exasperate
to offend sb/to make a faux pas/a faux pas/see also 得罪[de2 zui4]
to commit an offense/to violate the law/excuse me! (formal)/see also 得罪[de2 zui5]
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to speak rudely
lit. if you can't eat it all, you'll have to take it home (idiom)/fig. you'll have to take the consequences
pinyin: chi1 bu5 liao3 dou1 zhe5 zou3

definition: to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
